DOC.brief_summary: The study aims to show variation in CA-125 and other inflammatory markers assumed to be a response to trauma and peritoneal inflammation in the perioperative period of laparoscopic ventral hernia repair
DOC.brief_title: CA125 Levels and Other Inflammatory Markers in Laparoscopic Ventral Hernia Repair
DOC.detailed_description: CA-125 and other inflammatory markers as body temperature, CRP, PCT, leucocytes and neutrophils measured pre- and post-operatively - correlated to trauma size i.e. area of dissection, mesh size, number of fixation points etc.
DOC.criteria: Adults admitted for ventral or incisional hernia repair Lossofdomain ASA above III Liver failure Abnormal CA125 prior to surgery
